Comment: The morpheme ra is not actually an object marker in this sentence, since the verb is intransitive. According to Bibiri, kiha ra (or kihara) is the same as kihaha; that is, it is marked as having feminine agreement.

Translated_Text: "Give some food to the old man."
"He came here because he is hungry," she said.

Comment: This sentence does not have a verb, which is not that uncommon; but it also has the secondary verb awine, which is normally only found with verbs. There is a similar sentence in "Siraba", sentence (60).
